caption.p: (A) Repurposing drugs to treat COVID 19. (B) Combinations of drugs used in the SOLIDARITY project by WHO.

tr.td: A JAK inhibitor that may interfere with the inflammatory processes
Hepatitis C, Ebola virus, Marburg virus
Inhibition of Inosine monophosphate dehydrogenase(induction of mutagenesis)
RSV infection, hepatitis C, some viral hemogrrhagic fevers
A puirne nucleoside that acts as an alternative substrate leading to inaccurate viral RNA synthesis
An inhibitor that may disrupt that binding of viral envelope protein to host cells and prevent viral entry to the target cell
A drug that may inhibit viral protein expression
Various helminthic, protozoal, and viral infection-caused diarrhoea
A drug that can elevate endosomal pH and interfere with ACE2 glycosylation
Protease inhibitors that may inhibit the viral protease: 3CLpro or PLpro
Used in combination for HIV virus treatment
A nucleotide analogue that may block viral nucleotide synthesis to stop viral replication

td.p: (used in combination with Lopinavir and Ritonavir)

tr.td: Molecules of innate and adaptive immune system
Supress T cell activation, activates macrophages that engulf antigens and NK cells, activates different immunomodulators and antiviral proteins
